importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the discovery of Harper Lee's short stories was announced and when the collection 'The Land of Sweet Forever' will be published.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time period during which Harper Lee wrote her early short stories in New York City after dropping out of law school, before writing 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

keyTakeAways: Harper Lee's long-time association with 'To Kill a Mockingbird' as her only major work has been challenged by the discovery of eight previously unpublished short stories.
The collection 'The Land of Sweet Forever' includes these short stories and eight essays written by Lee after the publication of 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.
The short stories were written during Lee's time in New York City, a period when she was developing her writing voice.
The collection is introduced by Casey Cep, Harper Lee’s biographer, and is described as revealing insights into the formative years of her literary voice.
The stories contain early versions of themes found in 'To Kill a Mockingbird', as well as narratives about life in New York, indicating the evolution of her storytelling style.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Harper Lee’s previously unknown short stories, written during her formative years in New York City after dropping out of law school, have been discovered and will be published for the first time in a collection titled 'The Land of Sweet Forever'. The stories, described as 'apprentice stories', contain early versions of themes from her famous novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' and offer a glimpse into her development as a writer. The collection is introduced by biographer Casey Cep and includes eight essays written by Lee after the publication of her iconic novel. Personal recollections from her nephew Edwin Lee Conner and cousin Molly Lee highlight Lee’s storytelling abilities and suggest that these works represent an early, formative stage of her literary voice.
title: Harper Lee’s newly discovered short stories set to be published
